Title.evidence: Preoperative Breast MRI in Breast Cancer: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised multicentre trial included 440 patients

Participants.evidence: patients aged 56 years or less with newly diagnosed breast cancer, conducted at three breast cancer units

Intervention.evidence: randomised to preoperative MRI (n=220) or conventional imaging (n=220)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the long-term outcomes of preoperative MRI compared to conventional imaging.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was DFS, measured over a 10-year follow-up.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: randomised to preoperative MRI (n=220) or conventional imaging (n=220) between 2007 and 2010

Number_Analysed.evidence: DFS rates were 85.5% in the MRI group and 80.0% in the control group

Result_Outcome.evidence: DFS rates were 85.5% in the MRI group and 80.0% in the control group (HR 1.46, 95% CI 0.93 to 2.29; P=0.099)

Funding.evidence: Supported by Capio St Goran’s Hospital Research Foundation, Centre for Clinical Research, Vastmanland Hospital, Percy Falk Foundation, and Vastmanland Research Foundation against Cancer.
